channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On Picard's Theorem Via Nevanlinna Theory
item.description: arXiv:2405.09659v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study a long-standing Picard's problem for non-compact complete K\"ahler manifolds with non-negative Ricci curvature. When the manifold carries a positive Green function, a positive answer is given to the Picard's problem, i.e., it is showed that every meromorphic function on such a manifold reduces to a constant if it omits three distinct values.
item.dc:creator: Xianjing Dong

item.title: Construction of a Basis of K\"{a}hler differentials for generic plane branches
item.description: arXiv:2405.09684v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Let ${\mathcal C}$ be a fixed equisingularity class of irreducible germs of complex analytic plane curves. We compute a basis of the ${\mathbb C}[[x]]$-module of K\"ahler differentials for generic $\Gamma \in {\mathcal C}$, algorithmically, and study its behaviour under blow-up. As an application, we give an alternative proof for a formula of Genzmer, that provides the dimension of the generic component of the moduli of analytic classes in the equisingularity class of $\Gamma$.
item.dc:creator: Pedro Fortuny Ayuso, Javier Rib\'on

item.title: Cyclicity in Besov-Dirichlet spaces from the Corona Theorem
item.description: arXiv:2405.09921v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Tolokonnikov's Corona Theorem is used to obtain two results on cyclicity in Besov-Dirichlet spaces.
item.dc:creator: Yabreb Mohamed Egueh (IMB), Karim Kellay (IMB), Mohamed Zarrabi (IMB)

item.title: Bogomolov-Gieseker inequality for log terminal K\"ahler threefolds
item.description: arXiv:2405.10003v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this article we are concerned with two main themes revolving around compact K\"ahler spaces with log terminal singularities. The first one is the orbifold version of the Bogomolov-Gieseker inequality for stable $\mathbb Q$-sheaves on threefolds while the second one has to do with the construction of canonical metrics on such spaces and their properties.
item.dc:creator: Henri Guenancia, Mihai P\u{a}un

item.title: A note on the equivalence of Gromov boundary and metric boundary
item.description: arXiv:2405.10273v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we introduce the concept of quasihyperbolically visible spaces. As a tool, we study the connection between the Gromov boundary and the metric boundary.
item.dc:creator: Vasudevarao Allu, Abhishek Pandey

item.title: Linear isometries of Hol(D)
item.description: arXiv:2402.14671v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: A complete characterisation is given of all the linear isometries of the Fr\'echet space of all holomorphic functions on the unit disc, when it is given one of the two standard metrics: these turn out to be weighted composition operators of a particular form. Operators similar to an isometry are also classified. Further, the larger class of operators isometric when restricted to one of the defining seminorms is identified. Finally, the spectra of such operators are studied.
item.dc:creator: I. Chalendar, L. Oger, J. R. Partington

item.title: Computing Chebyshev polynomials using the complex Remez algorithm
item.description: arXiv:2405.05067v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We employ the generalized Remez algorithm, initially suggested by P. T. P. Tang, to perform an experimental study of Chebyshev polynomials in the complex plane. Our focus lies particularly on the examination of their norms and zeros. What sets our study apart is the breadth of examples considered, coupled with the fact that the degrees under investigation are substantially higher than those in previous studies where other methods have been applied. These computations of Chebyshev polynomials of high degrees reveal discernible patterns which allow for conjectures to be formulated based on abundant experimental evidence. The use of Tang's algorithm allows for computations executed with precision, maintaining accuracy within quantifiable margins of error. Additionally, as a result of our experimental study, we propose what we believe to be a fundamental relationship between Chebyshev and Faber polynomials associated with a compact set.
item.dc:creator: Olof Rubin

item.title: On the Smooth Curve of Entire Vector Fields that Solves the Navier-Stokes Equation
item.description: arXiv:2405.07929v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this paper we prove the existence and smoothness of the Navier-Stokes Equation for viscosity large enough which after rescaling implies a solution for any positive viscosity, additionally, we show the existence of a curve of entire vector fields of order 2 that extends the solution to the complex domain for positive time.
item.dc:creator: Brian David Vasquez Campos
